papers: Agozzino et al. - 2006 - Minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules in the transbronchial biopsy of a lung transplant recip
Aksel et al. - 2019 - An Unusual Case of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Accompanying with Cystic Lung Disease
Alkurashi et al. - 2020 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Lung Disease Presenting with Diffuse Ground-Glass Opa

results.filename: Agozzino et al. - 2006 - Minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules in the transbronchial biopsy of a lung transplant recip.pdf

data.filename: Agozzino et al. - 2006 - Minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules in the transbronchial biopsy of a lung transplant recip.pdf
data.patient_demographics_narrative: 56-year-old male lung transplant recipient who underwent double lung transplantation for end-stage severe respiratory failure due to bullous emphysema
data.associated_conditions_narrative: History of bullous emphysema, chronic lung failure and right heart failure with severe secondary pulmonary hypertension prior to transplant
data.discovery_reason: Incidental finding during routine post-transplant monitoring
data.ct_narrative: High-resolution CT scan did not detect nodules in the lung parenchyma
data.pathological_features_narrative: Single minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodule (MPMN) found in 1 of 6 lung samples. Nodule showed typical morphology of meningothelial cells. Immunostaining was negative for cytokeratins, S-100, desmin, alpha smooth muscle-actin, HHF35, myosin, h-caldesmon, CD34, synaptophysin, NSE, chromogranin, and estrogen/progesterone receptors. Positive staining for vimentin and EMA.
data.diagnostic_approach: Transbronchial biopsy (TBB) with immunohistochemical staining. High-resolution CT scan performed to rule out other lesions.
data.immunohistochemistry_narrative: MPMN stained negative with anti-cytokeratins (CAM5.2, CK7, AE1/E3), S-100, desmin, alpha smooth muscle-actin, HHF35, myosin, h-caldesmon, CD34, synaptophysin, NSE, chromogranin, and estrogen/progesterone receptors. Positive staining for vimentin and EMA (epithelial membrane antigen).
data.management_narrative: Patient was under standard immunosuppressive regimen (cyclosporine A, azathioprine, and steroids) and received rabbit anti-thymocyte antibodies as induction therapy. Regular monitoring through clinical, functional and endoscopic follow-up including TBB at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months post-transplant.
data.outcomes: Patient was functionally stable at 7-month follow-up with good graft function. Best post-transplant forced expiratory volume in 1 second was 3.87 liters.

results.filename: Aksel et al. - 2019 - An Unusual Case of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Accompanying with Cystic Lung Disease.pdf

data.filename: Aksel et al. - 2019 - An Unusual Case of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Accompanying with Cystic Lung Disease.pdf
data.symptom_narrative: Patient presented with cough and mild exertional dyspnea
data.ct_narrative: Thorax HRCT showed bilaterally multiple, uniform, thin-walled cysts ranging between 0.5 and 2.5 cm in diameter, diffusely distributing from apex to basis of the lung. Upon review, micronodules smaller than 1 mm were identified.
data.diagnostic_approach: Bronchoscopy followed by diagnostic right lower lobe and middle lobe wedge resections
data.method_of_diagnosis: Surgical wedge resection with histopathological examination
data.outcomes: No changes in thorax CT findings through three years follow up

results.filename: Alkurashi et al. - 2020 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Lung Disease Presenting with Diffuse Ground-Glass Opa.pdf

data.filename: Alkurashi et al. - 2020 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Lung Disease Presenting with Diffuse Ground-Glass Opa.pdf
data.patient_demographics_narrative: 55-year-old woman, lifelong nonsmoker, worked as a saleswoman. Medical history included hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, hypothyroidism, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and impaired fasting blood glucose.
data.associated_conditions_narrative: History of hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, hypothyroidism, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and impaired fasting blood glucose. Patient was on lisinopril 10 mg, levothyroxine 125 mcg, and omeprazole 20 mg daily.
data.symptom_narrative: Patient presented with "non-exertional chest pressure and dry cough of 4-month duration". Physical examination was unremarkable.
data.discovery_reason: Symptomatic presentation with chest pressure and dry cough
data.pulmonary_function_testing_spirometry_na: Pulmonary function tests did not reveal any abnormalities.
data.ct_narrative: High-resolution chest CT showed innumerable diffuse small ground-glass nodules, some of which were cavitary in nature.
data.pathological_features_narrative: Pathology showed multiple well-circumscribed interstitial meningothelial-like nodules in perivenular distribution with occasional whorling of cells.
data.diagnostic_approach: Patient underwent right video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) with multiple lung biopsies. Laboratory workup included complete blood count, inflammatory markers, autoimmune testing (ANA, anti-dsDNA, anti-scl-70, RNA polymerase III antibodies, rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP antibody, ANCA), hypersensitivity pneumonitis panel, cystic fibrosis genetic mutation testing, and fungal serologies - all negative.
data.outcomes: One year after diagnosis, patient continued to complain of non-exertional chest pressure without pulmonary complaints. Repeat imaging showed stable findings.
data.authors_followup_recommendation_narrativ: Authors note that "further research is needed to better understand this disease and its clinical significance."
